title: Introduction to Node.js
author: John Doe
content: Node.js is a runtime environment that allows you to run JavaScript code outside a browser.

title: Getting Started with MongoDB
author: Jane Smith
content: MongoDB is a NoSQL database that stores data in JSON-like documents.

title: Understanding Express Middleware
author: Alex Johnson
content: Middleware functions are functions that have access to the request and response objects in Express.

title: Modern JavaScript Features
author: Emily White
content: ES6 and newer versions of JavaScript introduced many useful features such as let/const, arrow functions, and async/await.

title: Deploying Apps to Heroku
author: Michael Brown
content: Heroku is a platform-as-a-service that enables you to deploy web applications easily.
